attributes.action: Address the discrepancies in widening accesss scheme payments across NHS trusts
attributes.background:
1000’s of NHS workers are out of pocket after being wrongly taxed by bosses. They have been caught in a payroll error that docked their cash on training allowances and scholarships.
But instead of an instant rebate, the staff are having to sort out the tax mess with individual Trusts and HMRC.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/shambolic-confusing-system-sees-thousands-9197458.amp

attributes.action: Fund seizure alarms for everyone with Epilepsy
attributes.background: I decided to start this petition after my son, 2 years old, got diagnosed with epilepsy and started to have nocturnal seizures. 1st December 2016 is when it all began with his first seizure - a 4 hour status seizure which resulted in him having to be placed into a coma on life support for 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details: Sudden Unexpected Death in Epilepsy (SUDEP) is when a person with epilepsy dies suddenly and prematurely, and no other cause of death is found. Around 1,200 people die from Epilepsy each year in the UK. Around half of these deaths are SUDEP (sudden unexpected death in epilepsy). If you have seizures during the night, having a seizure alarm that alerts someone if you have a seizure is a life changer. The Government must provide enough funding for everyone who needs one.

attributes.action: A call from the UK for UN Peace Keeping Force in Southern Cameroon at the UN
attributes.background: There is ongoing violence perpetrated by Government Forces and Southern Cameroonian militants in the English-Speaking part of Cameroon, specifically the North-West and South-West Regions. The UK needs to call for a UN peacekeeping force in Southern Cameroon.
attributes.additional_details: The English speaking part of Cameroon has for over 60 years since joining La Republique du Cameroun been subjected to marginalization and oppression of the Anglo-Saxon culture, which was considered untouchable during the unity of the two Regions to form the Federal Republic of Cameroon. There is the need for meaningful dialogue to resolve the crisis. Without an independent UN Observer to monitor peace and oversee dialogue, we could have a genocide on our hands.

attributes.action: Legislate against anyone with EU pension serving in Commons or Lords.
attributes.background: I believe that EU pensions are a clear conflict of interest while leaving the EU. Legislate to make it illegal for anyone receiving or due to receive such a pension from serving in House of Commons or House of Lords.

attributes.action: Reject calls to add American Bulldogs to the dangerous dog act.
attributes.background: Peta, an organization that is meant to dedicated to the protection of animals has called on the UK government that it should add American bulldogs to the dda, effectively banning them outright. Breed specific legislation is nout an effective solution. I suggest the law notices deed not breed

attributes.action: Standardise speed limits for vehicles up to 3500kg
attributes.background: Currently commercial vehicles including light weight vans are limited to 60mph on dual carrageways and 50 mph on single. This causes confusion and frustration for vehicles following.
attributes.additional_details: Not everyone is aware of this rule and probably wonder why vans are traveling slowly, holding up traffic, forcing following vehicles to overtake which can be hazardous. People who are unaware of the rule can find themselves with an unnecessary speeding ticket.

attributes.action: Increase maintenance loans to students living in Oxford to London weighting
attributes.background: After being ranked the least affordable city in the UK to live, it would make sense that the government and student finance reflect this fact in the amount of maintenance loan students living in Oxford receive, but they do not. Rent and living costs in Oxford are well above the national average.
attributes.additional_details:
Studying and living in Oxford is financially straining on all students, affecting a students ability to achieve the best grades possible as they have to work long hours in a part time job just to live.

With the added pressure of part-time work, on top of an already strenuous University schedule, a students mental and physical health, alongside grades, can suffer.

The government need to assess the financial situation students within Oxford, as well as other expensive cities and fix the issue.

attributes.action: To make the Drug MDPV Monkey Dust Class A, users need support also
attributes.background: Monkey Dust is causing so much trouble to services up and down the country and destroying the lives of many people. People who take this drug are ending up in Prisons, while others are harming themselves without been aware of their own personal injuries.
attributes.additional_details: The local and national media have reported a massive rise in the use of this drug and communities have been effected through crimes such as robberies.

attributes.action: Fund afamelanotide on the NHS to treat erythropoietic protoporphyria
attributes.background: Erythropoietic Protoporphyria is a life changing genetic condition, your body has a reaction when exposed to UV and visible light. You can't go out without covering head to toe, just to be able to leave the house. Inside all blinds must be closed, also lights to be checked. No prevention or cure.
attributes.additional_details:
Reactions mean weeks of agony. You feel like your blood is on fire, pain beyond words that no medication touches. Skin dries and cracks. You can’t talk, eat, and  struggle to drink. It can also lead to liver failure and Vitamin D and iron deficiencies. 
 
There is a treatment that works and other countries are using it but NICE has said no, because it’s too expensive. We are pleading for the government to fund this treatment and give EPP sufferers a chance of a normal life

attributes.action: Outdoor nature-based learning to be compulsory and weekly in all English schools
attributes.background: We believe that not enough children of all ages are being exposed to weekly outdoor sessions in all seasons and all weathers, connecting with nature and involved with sustainability, knowing practical ways to care and protect the world they live in
attributes.additional_details: This campaign is led by a forest school leader.

attributes.action: Ban the use of glyphosate in the UK
attributes.background:
Since classified a probable carcinogen, many are saying NO to glyphosate.

Why not prove chemicals safe before allowing use? 

UK GOV If you take your duty of care seriously, you would ban it now, pending review, as there is no proof it does not cause illnesses & mounting evidence it does.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is on behalf of ‘Against Glyphosate Europe’ - A networking, solidarity and information exchange group for European based campaigners wanting to effect Glyphosate bans. (Can be found on facebook)

Reasons to ban: 

1)	Dewayne Johnson against Monsanto - www.theguardian.com/business/2018/aug/11/one-mans-suffering-exposed-monsantos-secrets-to-the-world

2)	WHO: ‘probably carcinogenic’ 

3)	Glyphosate can cause cancer: www.euronews.com/2016/07/01/glyphosate-can-cause-cancer

4) Many countries banning it

Too many more to list - do your research

attributes.action: Debate a ‘National Strategy to Promote the Switch to Cloth Nappies.’
attributes.background: More families would switch to cloth with sufficient information and a financial incentive. Ringfence money so councils can effectively promote cloth through well resourced libraries, liaison with antenatal/ postnatal services and incentives. Hold manufacturers of disposable accountable to help fund.
attributes.additional_details:
In the UK, app 8 million nappies are thrown daily; app 3% of our household waste* (app. half a million tons, annually)**. One baby will produce app. 1 ton of waste*** which takes > 200 years to biodegrade. Disposable nappies also have greater environmental costs due to the production process. Those who use cloth tend to switch to reuseable wipes and bags, further reducing use of single use items.
Councils pay £88.95 p/tonne, in landfill tax.
*Veolia ** recyclingexpert.co.uk
*** kickscount.org.uk

attributes.action: The Saudi Arabian Ambassador should be expelled.
attributes.background: The Saudi armed forces are attacking Yemen with bad reconnaissance. The result is the large scale killing of innocent civilians. The Saudi authorities permit this situation to perpetuate.
attributes.additional_details: At least 29 children have been killed and 30 wounded in a Saudi-led coalition air strike in Yemen, the International Committee of the Red Cross says. The children were travelling on a bus that was hit at a market in Dahyan, in the northern province of Saada. The health ministry run by the rebel Houthi movement put the death toll at 43, and said 61 people were wounded. The coalition, which is backing Yemen's government in a war with the Houthis, said its actions were "legitimate".

attributes.action: All children's bicycles sold in the UK to have handlebar plugs fitted.
attributes.background: Children are injured, and even killed, by the handlebars of their own bikes. These deaths are preventable. I would like to update British Standards. Initially through an immediate voluntary action and then into BS EN 16054 (BMX) & BS EN ISO 8098 (childrens').
attributes.additional_details: Bicycle handlebar trauma has been well documented in children. Spleen, liver, pancreatic lacerations and renal injuries are the most commonly traumatized sites. Other reported injuries are traumatic abdominal wall hernias and ruptures, aortic rupture, transection of the common bile duct, traumatic arterial occlusion, and groin injuries Presumably, the handlebar of a typical child's bicycle acts as a spear, concentrating what may be a relatively small amount of energy into a focal point of injury.

attributes.action: Stop sex offenders being held at Hollesley Bay prison
attributes.background: Hollesley bay is an open prison with a public access road right through its grounds. There is a primary school within a 4 minute walk and areas open to the public where people take their children to play.

attributes.action: Reduce the age of the meningitis Acwy vaccine to 3months
attributes.background: In November 2017 we lost our 10 month old daughter to meningitis W which is something no one gets a vaccine against until they are roughly 14. The only way to get this vaccine is to pay privately, which can cost about £200.
attributes.additional_details:
If this vaccine had been available maybe my little Lily would still be with all her family today. I don’t know what else to do other than try and look at getting the age reduced to try and prevent this happening to any other people. All please sign and share. There is probably plenty of other petitions going around for this but the more there is we stand more of a chance 
Thank you

attributes.action: Commission a statue of Enoch Powell to be placed outside Parliament
attributes.background: In light of the contribution made to the UK by his actions in Parliament and in the Armed Forces we urge that a stature of Enoch Powell is commissioned and placed outside Parliament to honour his dedication to his country.

attributes.action: Overturn a Home Office decision regarding a Kidney Donor who was refused a visa
attributes.background:
Gulfraz Ahmed, 33 of Luton is in need of a life saving kidney transplant.

Throughout his life he has suffered many serious health issues. By the age of 12 both his kidney's had deteriorated. His mother had provided a life saving kidney donor at the time, which has so far kept him going until now.
attributes.additional_details:
Gulfraz's only kidney has now deteriorated to the point he requires dialyses 3 times a week. This is costing the NHS £50,000 a year.

Gulfraz's family have found a match after extensive tests in Pakistan. All that is required is a 6 months visa to accommodate this transplant.

However the application has been refused by the Home Office.

We are seeking the Home Office to display compassion on the grounds to save a young successful business man's life. Sadly this is a matter of life or death.

attributes.action: Stop Postal Votes except for the elderly and disabled
attributes.background:
There is too much fraudulent use of Postal Votes.
Some people even sell theirs and this produces an unfair advantage. We must maintain a level playing field.

attributes.action: Remove the requirement to pay VAT by churches, specifically on building works.
attributes.background: 20% VAT is payable on extensions and refurbishments by churches (and other bodies) which are being undertaken for local communities, many in deprived areas and the amount taken from any funds raised by the churches makes it, in a lot if instances, difficult to carry out all the work required.
attributes.additional_details: Our church in Denton undertook a refurbishment in 2005 which brought many people & groups into the church & its premises, at a time when councils were closing facilities. Churches help by housing groups that otherwise would have to close, or at least restrict the work that they do. This type of includes working with various health groups, places for the young and old to meet, and much more. We are looking at a £1,000,000 project which incurs £200k in tax, this mean much of it will not be done.

attributes.action: Mandatory minimum sentence for shaken baby deaths no guilty plea reduction.
attributes.background: We are calling for a mandatory minimum sentence of 15 years when an offender kills a child through shaking the infant. This should also mean that they are not eligible for the reduction in sentence when pleading guilty to get a lower jail term.
attributes.additional_details: The case of lee sweet who pled guilty to manslaughter of his son should serve as a warning that this should never happen again.  No family should have to wait a year to lay to rest such a precious life, let alone have to watch as he received a third reduction in sentence for pleading guilty after 11 months of denining it.

attributes.action: Any parent convicted of a child sexual offence to be stripped of parental rights
attributes.background: As it stands both parents have joint parental rights and responsibilities of their children if born from 2003 whether married or not.
attributes.additional_details: Convicted Paedophiles and sex offenders with children born from 2003 still have legal rights and responsibilities over their children. This needs to change as no parent or guardian should have to fight in a family court to have those right revoked.

attributes.action: Require political parties to have robust procedures for tackling discrimination
attributes.background: Traditionally, British political parties are regulated only by the electorate, apart from basic rules on matters such as campaign funding which are enforced by the Electoral Commission. There are no rules against discrimination.
attributes.additional_details:
It is clear that political parties are not trusted to deal with discrimination themselves. For example, our polling has found that 92% of British Jews feel that UK political parties tolerate antisemitism.

The law should require political parties to have fair, efficient and transparent procedures for tackling discrimination amongst members, or the parties should face substantial fines.

Political parties should be obliged to meet a minimum requirement for tackling discrimination of all forms, including antisemitism, based on the Campaign Against Antisemitism’s guidance at https://antisemitism.uk/politics/manifesto.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for ticket resales to be more than 10% of Face Value
attributes.background: Today, May 1st 2018, we waited patiently to buy one of 90,000 tickets available for a London NFL game on Ticketmaster. Within the space of five minutes, they were sold out and available on other sites such as Viagogo for more than four times their face value.
attributes.additional_details: For example, we have paid £170 each for tickets which, through Ticketmaster, should have cost us £41 each. This is not just making a profit, this is theft. It is taking advantage of people who are desperate to see their idols, to experience something for the first time ever, who have worked exceptionally hard towards.

attributes.action: FA2017 Part 2 Clause 29(2) to include calorific maltodextrin
attributes.background: Calorific maltodextrin has high GI but not included as sugars. Consumers are misled as to amount of sugars in drinks where glycemic maltodextrin not included.  Sugar drinks levy should take account of all glycemic carbohydrates

attributes.action: Close the loophole that allows second home owners to evade council tax and rates
attributes.background:
In England, second home owners can avoid council tax by claiming to be a business if they say they are available for letting for 140 days a year - they do not have to actually let at all.
As their rateable value is below £12k, they also qualify for 100% small business rate relief - so pay nothing.
attributes.additional_details:
In Southwold, on the Suffolk coast, where most houses are second homes, this loophole costs the local council about half a million pounds every year in lost revenue because 257 of these homes claim to be a business and pay nothing. 
It is grossly unfair that people with two homes should be subsidized by people with no, or only one, home.
Most genuine businesses do not now qualify for small business rate relief because the latest revaluation has put them above the ceiling.

attributes.action: Total ban on killing and eating of dogs and cats in uk
attributes.background: Total ban and new legislation to make the killing of cats and dogs for the purpose of food consumption illegal in the UK. The current law is that it is illegal to sell dog meat through licensed channels to the public, but actually eating dog and cat meat is not a specifically banned practice in UK.
attributes.additional_details: Daily mail article dated 6th August 2018

attributes.action: Criminalise the export of cannabis
attributes.background: The government contradicts itself by telling the public that cannabis should not be legalised as it has no medicinal benefit however the United Kingdom is the biggest exporter of cannabis in the world. If it's illegal to sell on the streets it should be illegal to sell overseas.

attributes.action: Allow American author Robert Spencer to enter the UK and speak freely
attributes.background: The prominent American author Robert Spencer was barred from entering the UK in 2013. Despite having committed no crime, Mr Spencer was prevented from speaking in Britain following his criticisms of Islam, a subject on which he has written widely. He should not be denied UK entry because of this.
attributes.additional_details: Spencer was barred from entering Britain by then Home Secretary Theresa May. Mrs May deemed his presence in the UK as "not conducive to the public good". Spencer had committed no crime, had not incited violence, but expressed his views about the Koran and Mohammed. We demand that this ban is lifted and that Robert Spencer be allowed entry to the UK.

attributes.action: Cancel Donald Trump’s visit to the U.K. due to the immigrant children scandal
attributes.background:
News and photographs are now everywhere regarding the new zero tolerance policy which has seen children as young as 12 months old taken from their parents at the border and placed alone into ‘detention centres’ and camps.
The British govt. must take a stand against this or we appear to condone it.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-nation/wp/2018/06/16/america-is-better-than-this-what-a-doctor-saw-in-a-texas-shelter-for-migrant-children/?utm_term=.150870f3644a

https://www.nytimes.com/2018/06/05/world/americas/us-un-migrant-children-families.html

attributes.action: Change the rules on accessibility to schools to match that of planning.
attributes.background: Planning applications are judged as being accessible when within a walking distance of 2km and cycling distance of 5km to amenities.  The rules for school children should match this.  This should mean safe cycle routes for a significant amount of the current 3 mile walking distance.
attributes.additional_details:
To walk 3miles takes about an hour, whilst cycling this distance would take about 20 minutes. This reduces the amount of time children have at home to study or attend extra curricular activities.
If walking upto 2km for adults is suitable then how can the government justify the 3miles(5km) for children as young as 11?
We would like the rules changed so that those traveling upto 3 miles will have a safe cycle route most of the distance and be able to travel with a cycle the rest of the way.

attributes.action: Establish a special unit to tackle the misconduct of public officials.
attributes.background:
Abuse of the public's trust has become normalised: it is simply accepted as the way things are and not treated as the criminal offence that it is.
The police cannot get involved in political decisions and for this reason have proven too cautious over this offence, hence the need for a special unit.
attributes.additional_details:
Taking the nation to war on a lie or rending the nation asunder with a promise that there is no intention of keeping are serious abuses of the public's trust, or at least they appear so to me. 

https://www.cps.gov.uk/legal-guidance/misconduct-public-office

Too often we hear tales of public officers abusing their powers to line their pockets or conceal their wrongdoings, yet we almost never hear of these things being investigated. This need to stop.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for domesticated cats and dogs to be spayed/neutered.
attributes.background: Not spaying/neutering pets has caused shelters to be full to capacity.,therefore there are many strays and feral animals on the streets, struggling  to survive with little help.

attributes.action: Stop UK government funding the Syrian Civil Defence, AKA the "White Helmets."
attributes.background: Major questions have been raised about the actions of the Syrian Civil Defence, AKA the "White Helmets."

attributes.action: Make home to school disabled transport free for young adults aged 16 to 19
attributes.background:
I am a parent of a child with a disability. She begins college in 2019 and has no choice but to travel to one approx. 30 minutes drive away. This is our local SEN college and transport will cost over £900pa. 
I ask to review this legislation to ensure that all children can access a free education.
attributes.additional_details: Disabled home to school transport provided by the local authority is free for children up to age 16 as outlined in current disabled legislation. However after 16 this is no longer the case although it is compulsory for a child to stay in a form of education until they are 18. Many children with disabilities stay until 19+. This begs the question as to why disabled school transport is payable after 16. It isn’t means tested and families on low income/benefits will still have to pay up to £900+pa.

attributes.action: Change universal credit back to the previous benefit system that worked
attributes.background: Forced off ESA to attend a medical with someone unqualified to be forced onto universal credit which has left myself and many others below the poverty line and homeless!

attributes.action: Form a mandatory regulatory body for undertakers
attributes.background: When our daughter died, we visited the funeral director and were treated with a total lack of respect, and left in tears and angry at the lowest point of our lives. There are two trade associations for funeral directors, however it is not mandatory that they are members.
attributes.additional_details: The funeral director showed us no respect. His dog was yapping around our ankles, he kept answering his phone whilst we were trying to talk to him about our daughter’s funeral, at one point his wife even shouted into the room to give him an update on another funeral. My husband and son walked out, and when I told him we were grieving parents, his argument was that he was really busy at the moment. These are things that no person who has lost a loved one should have to go through.

attributes.action: Stop pets being sold online. Many are by breeders, pup farmers, dog theft gangs.
attributes.background: This would drastically cut down this crime and animals being sourced as bait.   Rescues don’t sell, but charge a fee, in most cases won’t cover the vets bills.  Rescue are full to bursting, due to all these criminals who steal pets etc. I’m a member of many who’ll back me on this.
attributes.additional_details:
A good breeder only has pups if asked, I know one and they are in total agreement on this.   
They have a web page but don’t sell pups on it.  People get their pups,either through the kennel club or word of mouth.
There’s no way of regulating this, it’s a great outlet for those who just see these  animals as objects to make money from.  The only way to help put a stop to it altogether is to make it illegal!! 
Online is mainly how puppy farming, back yard breeders sell the manly sickly pups they breed.
 People’s pets are mainly stolen to either sell online or backyard breed from them.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to advertise domestic pets free to good home on social media
attributes.background: Every day there are adverts for dogs and cats going free to a good home, more often than not a lady and gent turn up all smartly dressed but they are just the suppliers for those that train their dogs to fight in illegal dog fights. This has to stop, these individuals have a constant supply of bait
attributes.additional_details: Bedsforbullies rescue pick up the pieces of just some of the lucky ones who have escaped. Prime example is Della a 10 year old bull terrier who was once a very loved family pet who was given away or sold off and she ended up in the hands of these evil people, she escaped and was found by a policeman called Derek who contacted bedsforbullies to help with Della. She had horrific facial and body injuries where she had been savaged by fighting dogs. No charges were ever brought.

attributes.action: Motorcyclists to upgrade their CBT licence to ride a 250cc at 18
attributes.background: I believe that in order to decrease the jump in power, from a 125cc at 17 and 18, to 47bhp at 19, there should be an intermediate cc at 18, therefore I propose that at 18, a 125cc rider should be able to take another test, in order to ride a 250cc motorbike.
attributes.additional_details: Most riders jump from a 125cc to a restricted 600cc, which is way too much of a jump. 15bhp to 47bhp is more than enough to knock experienced 125cc riders off, if they're not careful. A smaller jump to 47bhp would increase safety for those who are willing to ride a 250cc at 18

attributes.action: To address the demise of High Street Businesses by reducing Business rates.
attributes.background:
My local high street is littered with empty shops and the few remaining businesses face closure in the coming months. This is a result of high business rates and rents.
The Government should either reduce business rates or devolve the setting of rates to local authorities.

attributes.action: Pressure the Nicaraguan government to stop the violent repression of protests.
attributes.background: Nicaragua has been rocked by the violent repression of peaceful student protests. The police have met protesters with live ammunition, killing many. The UK government alongside allies can pressure the Nicaraguan government stop the crackdown and facilitate peaceful protests.

attributes.action: Pass a law so that food labels must state exactly which ingredients they contain
attributes.background:
There have been several high profile cases of allergies causing death where the food labelling has not been correct.

Those with allergies can't eat a vast range of food due to the labels stating 'may contain'. For example, may contain nuts... Which nuts? Actual ingredients only should be listed.

attributes.action: Lower the maximum temperature allowed when transporting livestock after Brexit
attributes.background:
EU rules require the ability to keep the temperature under 35°C in the animal compartment, when transporting livestock on journeys over eight hours. 

35°C is inhumane and does not cover shorter journeys. There is also no guarantee of protection for livestock after Brexit.
attributes.additional_details:
Current EU guidance: 
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/farm-animal-welfare-during-transportation#eu-regulation-on-the-welfare-of-animals-in-transport

attributes.action: Amend the law so Chartered Legal Executives can certify Powers of Attorney
attributes.background: At present we cannot certify General or Lasting Powers of Attorney under existing legislation despite the fact that we can apply to run our own legal practices or be a Judge. It causes confusion for clients and we are having to rely on the goodwill of Solicitor colleagues to assist certifying copies

attributes.action: Protect 20% PPA time for all teachers.
attributes.background: There is a teacher retention crisis at the moment and rather than address that with realistic aims to stop experienced teachers leaving the profession there are recruitment pushes to get more people to train to likely leave after 4 years.
attributes.additional_details:
The majority of teachers would cite work/life balance as one of the biggest push factors, most would put this before salary.

The amount of unpaid overtime working evenings and weekends as standard is not sustainable and I would ask that all MPS teachers have a minimum of 20% protected PPA time.

Marking 13 class sets of books as well as planning excellent fully resourced and differentiated lessons in 126.5 hours a year is not achievable and needs to be addressed.

attributes.action: Remove compulsory GCSE English and maths resits for 16-18 year olds students
attributes.background: Compulsory GCSE resits do not apply to Apprentices or T Level students who may be enrolled on Functional Skills. Teachers should be allowed to select the most appropriate type of English and maths qualification for a students' onward progression, rather than being mandated by a Condition of Funding
attributes.additional_details: Government must change this failed and costly policy which shows that three-quarters of young people who failed to achieve a GCSE in English and maths at age 16, have still not achieved them by age 19 despite multiple attempts. FE professionals should be allowed to choose the most appropriate qualification linked to a student's intended destination. The AoC, AELP, and ASCL have called for the policy to be scrapped, with Ofsted stating that there are "serious questions" about it. Let's change it!

attributes.action: Make it a fineable offence to cross tidal roads outside of safe crossing times.
attributes.background: Every year dozens of people ignore the safe crossing times at the Holy Island causeway and are rescued by the RNLI. This not only risks lives and uses a service that could be required elsewhere, but also costs the taxpayer tens of thousands of pounds each year which could be avoided.
attributes.additional_details:
Figures from the Ministry of Defence in 2017 show a sea rescue costs approximately £1,900, while an air rescue by the RAF costs more than £4,000.

This petition relates to all tidal roads and causeways in the UK.

We, the undersigned, would like to see drivers who ignore safe crossing times on tidal roads/causeways and require rescue be fined for their actions, and for this money to be invested in the RNLI.

attributes.action: Amend the 2004 Hunting Act to include a minimum age requirement for hunt riders.
attributes.background: A child witnessing a fox killed by hounds during trail hunting has a psychological impact. It can be detrimental to their mental health and wellbeing.
attributes.additional_details:
A minimum age of 16 years old for riders with trail hunts is required. The accidental but brutal killing of an animal should never be witnessed by a minor.

Trail hunts can kill foxes. Regardless of whether a hunt chases and kills foxes intentionally or by accident, this is no place for a child. Children as young as 5 or 6 ride out on hunts. They are innocent and unaware of the intent of the hounds should they get on the scent of a fox. To witness such a violent act at a young age could normalise abusive behaviour and create an acceptance of animal cruelty.

attributes.action: Make substance testing facilities mandatory at music festivals
attributes.background:
To help avoid drug related deaths at music festivals, it is essential that changes are made to how events approach substance use.
 
I propose that it becomes mandatory to offer a safe risk free drug testing facility at music festivals.
attributes.additional_details:
If people have access to drug testing facilities they can be given information about the pills which could change their minds about whether to take the substance. 
 
It is clear that despite taking measures to prevent them accessing illegal substances, young people are still determined to indulge in them. Must we continue to watch people die before we do something to prevent this? 
 
With help from services like The Loop who already operate in the UK with support from law enforcement, events can prevent drug related deaths occurring.
